website_summaries.verdict: Consider this model if you're looking for a small, lightweight compass that you can attach to a watch or bag if you get tired of carrying it.
pros: Clips onto watch strap, sleeve, or bag easily
Provides accurate readings anywhere within the northern hemisphere
cons: A few people have said that their compass detached from its frame

customer_reviews.title: Will not honor warranty
customer_reviews.text: This compass developed a large bubble. A bubble large enough that is moves the needle. This is extremely annoying for a compass that costs this much. I called Suunto - send it to repair - called them and they tell me I have to pay shipping to and return. Then they suggested I call Amazon to see if they would offer me a replacement. I warned them of the coming review(s) and they were very nice but didn't care. No more Suunto for me. They even asked me to take a survey - first question was would I recommend Suunto - 0 was no way - told me that was invalid and they ended the call.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Cheap knock off
customer_reviews.text: Pretty sure I received a cheap knock off. There is no liquid inside the compass, the declination arrow moves about freely inside the compass, and the north arrow sticks. The package looks legit though. Too bad it's useless aside from being a child's toy.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Snow

customer_reviews.title: Compass falls out
customer_reviews.text: The compass fell out of its socket and got lost within a month after I clipped it to my wife's purse strap. The clip and socket remain on the purse strap. (See photo.) The compass is gone — who knows where.
customer_reviews.author: Gill Doyle

customer_reviews.title: Failed on second day....luckily not when I actually needed it.
customer_reviews.text: The compass worked for one day. While showing it to someone the second day I noticed it would point most anywhere but north. I moved away from buildings, held away from my body and everything else I could think of to make it be true. I will never own one of these. You cannot trust your life with a compass that fails you. Returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Well made, light weight, and easy to read!
customer_reviews.text: Super lightweight, accurate, and fits perfectly on a heavy duty 22mm NATO strap. It also fits well on a silicone strap but needed to be fed onto the strap from the end rather than clipped on at the desired point. This won’t completely replace a good orienteering compass, but for general navigation and reading maps that do not require distance calculation this is an excellent addition to your gear. I use this next to a stainless steel field watch and it has no effect on the bearing. The luminescent paint charges nice and bright in daylight or via a flashlight. Well made and easy to read!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew L

customer_reviews.title: Very lightweight at 1.04 ozs.
customer_reviews.text: I got the Suunto A-30. Points north. Rotating declination scale won't accidentally move off where you've placed it. North needle AND bezel ring glow in dark. I believe it's the kind of material that absorbs light and then 'glows' if the light is turned off. If you intend to use this in pitch dark I don't think it'll glow like a tritium (mildly radioactive substance that glows due to the substance decaying) watch dial. For those of you counting ounces, it weighs in at 1.04 ozs on the home postage scale. I like the magnifier in the center. I can leave my reading glasses at home and use the magnifier in the event I have to read something up close.
customer_reviews.author: Speedbrake

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I was disappointed with this Suunto. I have several different Suunto but they are older. The case of this compass is all plastic. The cover hinge isn’t a hinge at all, it’s just a thinning in the plastic. I’m sure it will wear out and snap off. The compass itself is simply snapped into he housing. The protective film on the mirror is difficult to remove. The whistle is nice and solid. The clip mechanism which holds whistle on to the compass seems a bit flimsy. Again I think it will wear out quickly. Overall not a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: The MacDonalds

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these from different sellers. Both defective out of the box. Chinese counterfeits maybe?
customer_reviews.author: Gar M.

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this product. I have trusted this compass many times and it hasn't failed me yet. A lot more accurate then most other button compasses. Just make sure this will fit your watch band good. If not it can be extremely uncomfortable I had to modify my watch band so that it would be comfortable for me. Once I did that I never took it off!
customer_reviews.author: HouserOutdoorsTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Small emergency compass...
customer_reviews.text: Nice size as it fits the back strap on most ball caps which means it is out of the way but always there to refer to if needed. I have several of these and they seem consistent from compass to compass. The degree bezel ring has a habit of coming off with the possible loss of the compass. I fix the problem by the application of a drop of super glue under the ring. I do not make use ot the degree markings so a non rotating ring does not affect the movement of the compass needle. This is just for rough direction not fine detail navigation, for that spend the money on a good compass.
customer_reviews.author: Guy V.

customer_reviews.title: Compass fell out of housing.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this a month ago and it was delivered quick. The button compass worked great and was a good quick way to get a bearing. I am in the mountains a lot for work and free time so its much easier to use this rather than pull out a full size compass every time. However today I went to use it and the compass had fallen out of the housing. I wore this on my watch band. No idea when or where it fell out. Looks like there is no adhesive on the housing side. Hoping to hear back from company to fix issue. Will update review if settled.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy  Kim

customer_reviews.title: It's a Suunto...can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought it was a little pricey but for what you get, it's a good deal. First of all. it's a Suunto. Second, it has a rotating bezel. Third, it's very accurate. Fourth, it has a direction of travel arrow. Fifth, it has a GREAT luminescent dial that stays lit for awhile. And sixth...it's the perfect size to clip onto anything. It works best with a watch band of 18mm. Buy a couple of these for your watch, backpack, or for you ladies, throw one in your purse. Great backup navigation.
customer_reviews.author: That XJ guy

customer_reviews.title: Great product but be aware of its wrist watch footprint
customer_reviews.text: Let me just say that, this product will not properly clip on a Casio G-Shock strap. Perhaps I could have determined that before I ordered it for exactly that purpose, but I screwed up and just assumed. The good news for me is it's easily attachable to many other things besides wrist watches. I have personally attached it to molle webbing and similarly thick straps on bags. I've finally decided to fashion this compass to a small bit of 550 paracord, to attach to my keyring - which works just fine. Beyond that, works as intended, is a very simple and useful design, and seems very durable. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Top Quality
customer_reviews.text: Top quality! Works like a charm as verified by multiple other compasses. I use these for paracord survival bracelets and they serve their purpose wonderfully. Wouldn't use any other compass for my bracelets! Can't go wrong with Suunto, they make some of the best in the business and this little guy is no exception. Lifetime warranty what more do you need?
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Brown

customer_reviews.title: Clearly a huge cut above the typical watchband compass in ...
customer_reviews.text: Clearly a huge cut above the typical watchband compass in its performance. I wish it was just a bit bigger but it works. My watch is a rather robust Dive watch with a big band, so use the photos to judge. No regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Carl H. Sheppard

customer_reviews.title: The best "button compass" on the market!
customer_reviews.text: This product is very versatile because of the variety of places where it can be attached, and because it has a rotating bezel I can do quick checks on my direction of travel without having to dig out my map compass each time. It is also a good secondary compass with which to check the accuracy of your primary compass. The only "nitpick" I have is with the sharp corners on the open side of the clip, as they dig into my wrist when wearing the compass on my watchband. However a minute's work with a fingernail file can correct that problem.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Richards

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you understand this is a very small compass
customer_reviews.text: I guess it is my bad that I really did not look more closely at all the photos and appreciate how small this compas really is... about the size of a quarter (US coin). I wanted something better than a cheap toy to use on the tank bag of my motorcycycle when I go on long trips and this item seemed like it would be better quality than some. This may work fine, just not sure I will be able to see it while riding
customer_reviews.author: Old Goof

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. It fits on my gshock mudman. But a couple of concerns. I'm worried I knock it off of my watch it's a clipper and it looks secure but who knows. Second the clip part is kinda pointed so it digs into my skin if I hold my wrist a certain way. But hey I ain't no wuss. I'm gonna wear it every day for EDC and I'm sure it'll hold up fine...hopefully will update if it falls off or gets lost. I am not using it for anything extreme so it should hold up fine.
customer_reviews.author: MR DAREN ALI

customer_reviews.title: These types of compasses aren't often all that good, but this one has surpassed all expectations
customer_reviews.text: These types of compasses aren't often all that good, but this one has surpassed all expectations. The clicky bezel puts it over the top. It might not be the cheapest, and while you may not want to rely on it as your primary means of navigation, I feel secure that whether I'm hiking or in the city that it isn't going to let me down.
customer_reviews.author: PC

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Compass Not A Toy
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with the quality. Definitely not a toy, but from a real compass manufacture Suunto. Mine was Made in Finland, points smoothly and doesn't have any air bubbles. Used it on a European trip as backup to cell phone GPS and was spot on. Don't depend entirely on electronics for finding your way around. Also, know the magnetic declination for your area of travel as this compass will point to magnetic North. Made navigating in an new city very comforting. I attached mine to a thin camera lanyard inside my day bag (like a pocket watch) to prevent loss and quick access. Oh, and it can be charged with a flashlight to make the lume brighter for evening navigation.
customer_reviews.author: GlCk

customer_reviews.title: Very uncomfortable on a watch band
customer_reviews.text: Very nicely made as you would expect, BUT if you plan on placing this on a watch band I don't recommend you bother. There are pointy extensions on the clip that dig into your flesh. The cheap $4 one this was designed to replace didn't have these issues. Suunto is a great brand and I have a wrist compass from them that works great. This, however falls short for it's intended use.
customer_reviews.author: Whitesheep

customer_reviews.title: Not bad...
customer_reviews.text: This compass digs into my skin when worn on my G-Shock. I bought a separate watch band for just it. The idea works well. It feels made of cheap, thin plastic. Feels like it could break easy. With that being said I've taken it on and off my G-Shock watch, which has a thick, grippy' resin strap several times and other straps with no breaking. All in all. I like it. I think the price point is a bit too high though. Still a cool product and does it's intended job. If I could I'd give it 3.5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart after a week.
customer_reviews.text: It is a brighr, wonderful and accurate little compass. I put it on my watch and. I had to sand parts of the bottoms that were jabbing in my flesh. A week after wearing it everywhere I looked down at work and the dial and compass had separated from the holder and were gone. I still had the clasp on my watch band... if it separated at work it never would of had a chance in the woods.
customer_reviews.author: derk devans

customer_reviews.title: good compass for a dive watch or emergency kit or just as a backup to the main compass on a boat.
customer_reviews.text: This compass is well made and functions as you would expect it to. It is good for a dive watch or emergency kit on a boat or hiking kit. The product is well made as with everything SUUNTO makes and sells. You need to hold it flat, horizontal to get a good calibration. It does not fit well on my large cheap watchbands. It does not fit well on my Casio watch, but fits nicely on my Armani watchband. It is a good looking product that looks like it belongs on the watch band. It is expensive at $20 for a mini-compass, but it works and looks expensive.
customer_reviews.author: John M. Beasley

customer_reviews.title: Broke the first time I used it
customer_reviews.text: Clipped this to my hunting pack, hiked all day and by the time I got back to the truck, the compass had fallen out of the clip. Only sign it was there was a lil glue mark showing me how insufficiently it was attached. I got the name brand thinking it would last longer. Guess not. You can see in this image from me hunting that it had fallen out while still on my chest strap by midday.
customer_reviews.author: Justin M. Park

customer_reviews.title: Handy Compass Easily Lost
customer_reviews.text: The Suunto is a good button compass. As a button compass I would rate it higher. However, it is easily lost. Clipped to a watch band, how I use it, it can pop off from the band or its clip case. This is true when I hike or do work around the yard (there I managed to find it). This is my third and last one I am going to buy. It is very handy having a compass on your wrist for a quick bearing, especially when hiking, It's just it has to stay there.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C.

customer_reviews.title: Great but...
customer_reviews.text: Great and accurate compass. However, my problem is with the part that slides over the watch band. I started to rub on my wrist to the point of redness and discomfort. I had to trim some excess plastic to round the edges more. Feels a bit better now.
customer_reviews.author: Jarvis

customer_reviews.title: Compass points north, moves freely... and ...
customer_reviews.text: Compass points north, moves freely...and is somewhere in a parking lot or who knows where because it fell out of the clip, which is still secured to my watch band. Maybe it was a fluke, but this thing didn't last two weeks of light use.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Not for tactical use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a tactical compass for my work. I had expectation of this compass giving me a quick and accurate response and readings. This compass uses a round disc style that floats on a needle. The disc often gets stuck when you try to read while walking or running. This compass gives lots of false readings when you are in motion. As a tactical compass this is not the compass you want to get. For general uses when you are not in motion, this compass does give okay direction.
customer_reviews.author: Howard Lee

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: The product was shipped in a protective case and arrived in good condition. Quality of this product is poor. The compass is easily detached from the frame that is intended to secure it to a watch band. It is highly likely that this item will be lost. The frame that attaches to the watchband will not secure adequately to a 22 mm nylon strap.
customer_reviews.author: William B.

customer_reviews.title: Good value.
customer_reviews.text: Fits my watchbands perfectly, can be easily removed and placed on my other watch bands or clipped onto my jacket or strap on a rucksack, the possibilities for placement could be dozens. Great little compass, settles fast and is easy to read and with the luminescent direction markers which are nice and bright it can be read at night.
customer_reviews.author: joliet jake

customer_reviews.title: Great for night use
customer_reviews.text: I have both the Suunto and the GoCompass wristband mounted compasses. The clip stays secure, however the compass popped out and was lost on my first purchase. Compass needs to be completely level, and is a little slower to respond. The GoCompas is a little more forgiving and quicker. What I like about this compass and why I bought it again: It’s smaller than the GoCompass, flat top not rounded. Black rotating bezel, make it less evident to others. Great luminescent dial! A perfect piece for navigating at night when you don’t want to lose your night vision to get a quick heading.
customer_reviews.author: AgentX

customer_reviews.title: They do the job I ask of them perfectly and I am happy to buy a few a year just to always ...
customer_reviews.text: I attach these to a survival bracelet I made and have bought at least 3 of these in the last year because I keep knocking them on things hard and breaking them. Why the 5 stars? Because they take a lot of abuse and function very well as a backup. They do the job I ask of them perfectly and I am happy to buy a few a year just to always have it on me.
customer_reviews.author: H. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Compass that doesn't point North!
customer_reviews.text: Looks great and looks like its well made..... the problem is it does NOT point North! Its not just a little off, it points 45Degrees NE. Checked it on or off my watch, also made sure no metal or other interference. Basically a really nice looking POS. Also the clip is really thin. Unless you have a nylon strap for a wristband or a velcro strap, this compass isn't going to slide on a metal or rubber wristband.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great little compass
customer_reviews.text: Best little compass on the market in my opinion. They are just so versatile. Great for a bug out bag. Can wear on a watch band or clip to to other things. Some watch bands are too thick for this though. I own 3.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for my motorcycle!
customer_reviews.text: Thought I would give this a try for use on my motorcycle. I didn't want anything huge or bulky. I'm pleased with the result. I like the emphasized north pointer. It is easy to see which way I'm headed at a glance. I use some double stick auto trim tape to mount it and it works well. The pointer is stable while riding. It's about the size of a quarter (see photo).
customer_reviews.author: HAZ

customer_reviews.title: A simple and practical compass built for outdoors people...
customer_reviews.text: Suunto has been in the compass business a lo-o-o-o-o-o-ng time...the company knows a thing or two about making a simple, practical compass for EDC. Compact, easy-to-read, accurate, sturdy, and ultra-lightweight. This one is a clear winner. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: wheelgunner

customer_reviews.title: small but useful
customer_reviews.text: picture is a bit deceiving. It is pretty small (large thumbnail) but my husband bikes and finds it clips inside his bike bag and it quite useful, without being in the way. He doesn't use GPS just his rails- to- trials maps and occasionally needs to re- orient himself on the trail when he is in the boonies.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle W

customer_reviews.title: Great Back UP
customer_reviews.text: This compass is small and accurate. Great to have in addition to a bigger one that you typically orient with. You could do it with just this but would be difficult for a beginner.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Did not fit watch band
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to put this on my Garmin Fenix 5 watch band, unfortunately it did not fit so I had to put it on a neck lanyard to wear. Suunto perhaps you guys can make a button compass they can fit on the watchbands of the new fitness watch bands. SFC Bing M. Yee (Ret.)
customer_reviews.author: Bing M. Yee

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit either of my Suunto watch bands
customer_reviews.text: It does function as a good compass however I cannot get this to fit on either of my Suunto watch bands ironically. It's not simply a sealed "sleeve" design that you can slide on but rather a clip on the side that must be closed so that you do not lose it. I have their Elementum Terra and Core but this won't work on either sadly. If you have a skinny band, it shouldn't be a problem but this is designed as a "one-size-fits-all."
customer_reviews.author: qualitycontrol

customer_reviews.title: Suunto Quality that you can trust!!
customer_reviews.text: I knew that if I spent a tiny bit more money I would have a quality compass made by a company that has been making compasses for decades. I like the rotating bezel too. I have a 16mm watch band from CountyComm that fits well with room for a wider band if necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: But the compass worked great, including in the rain
customer_reviews.text: Just completed 3 days backpacking with this little compass attached to my watchband. It performed flawlessly. Four stars instead of five because of the way it protrudes from the watchband and rubbed a sore spot on my wrist. But this may not happen to everyone. Next time i will attach it to a pack strap of something. But the compass worked great, including in the rain. I could do some basic land nav with it! I'm happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ron T.

customer_reviews.title: I used a nail file....
customer_reviews.text: I like it! But I had to take a nail file to the side of it. I wore it on a watch band (yeah I read other people having problems with that, but that's what I wanted) because the side of it had two sharp points sticking out of it. Other than that I had no problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R.

customer_reviews.title: Size
customer_reviews.text: Great for the money. Attaches anywhere, a little tough to get on however. Very accurate, but you got to hold it just so. is it the best compass, probably not... But it's the one you're likely to have with you! Great as a backup compass that you can't forget because it's attached.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Perry

customer_reviews.title: I have used a great many compass's from time in the Marines on
customer_reviews.text: I have used a great many compass's from time in the Marines on, for over 30 years, and this has always been a quick reference and spot on compass. Slip it on your watch, and forget it's there until you need to verify a azimuth. This is only my second one purchased and only because I want it on my other watch.
customer_reviews.author: Sempertodd

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product.
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for a quick reference and something that was reliable while hiking. Great for places where GPS won't go. In this case you definitely get what you pay for compared to the cheaper knockoff products.
customer_reviews.author: JJL

customer_reviews.title: Compass is lost! Oh the irony!
customer_reviews.text: I loved the compass and it looked great on my g-shock until it fell out and disappeared after a month. If you buy one, take the dial and compass out of the clip and glue the compass down.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel T

customer_reviews.title: Awesome backup tool for the backcountry
customer_reviews.text: Nice little backup compass to my normal Suunto A30. Attaches well to my G shock watch. Seems to be really accurate unlike the other button compasses I have used in the past and very easy to read. It also illuminates in the dark.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Lane Ponder

customer_reviews.title: Great compass, but be warned
customer_reviews.text: I love this and carry it daily on my watch band. I've had them for about a year and a half now, and I'm on my second (and hopefully last). The rotating bezel popped off the first one and the compass fell out without me noticing. Since I never really used the rotating bezel anyway, I've glued the second one in with JB Weld.
customer_reviews.author: Elliott Fackler

customer_reviews.title: Very inaccurate — Arrived with East bearing North
customer_reviews.text: Terrible compass, it came with East as North bearing, and steadily declined in what non-accuracy it had. The magnetic field from my body affects this thing. I wouldn’t count on any sort of bearing with this compass, the only saving grace is that I looks cool. That’s literally the only reason it stays on my watch.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Accurate, easy to read day or night.
customer_reviews.text: The Suunto Clipper is a very strong (magnetically speaking) compass. Liquid filled for dampening and bright luminescent cardinal points are a big plus. It’s on my keychain with a quick release to provide distance from ferrous metals. Exactly what I was looking for and arrived very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Abe Froman

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly 102 feet underwater
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to see how it would fair scuba diving, fully expecting it to fail with the first dive. However, much to my surprise, it worked perfectly for several dives and a max depth of 102 feet. I've been trying to convince my dive shop owner that he needs to stock these and sell them!
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Suunto is a serious company that makes only the best stuff. These really DO work
customer_reviews.text: A little expensive for a tiny compass, but most of the tiny button compasses you get in small survival kits simply DO NOT WORK! Suunto is a serious company that makes only the best stuff. These really DO work. Just like my full size Suunto dive compass, it is well worth the extra money!
customer_reviews.author: Paul L. from Cape Cod

customer_reviews.title: Small But Useful Compass
customer_reviews.text: Very convenient compass, albeit small. It clips onto my watch strap, so handy. Easy to attach, easy to read, and invaluable for those times when my regular compass isn't on my person.
customer_reviews.author: Jon S. Haas

customer_reviews.title: Compass falls apart.
customer_reviews.text: I really like these little compasses, but they like to pop out of their housing. When they work, they work. However they give you no warning that they are going to come apart and leave you without a compass.
customer_reviews.author: dellcontrol

customer_reviews.title: Good compass
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift. Size of an american quarter or nickle, not big at all. Diassemblable, and reassemblable, so if you drop it or pieces pop off, they go back together. I didn't think it would but small hands can pry it apart, so don't give it to your pet monkey.
customer_reviews.author: czz

customer_reviews.title: Cute compass
customer_reviews.text: Designed to clip on cloth sleeve or watch band. Not designed for thick or metal watch bands. However, seems to work well so decent value for a micro compass
customer_reviews.author: JimA

customer_reviews.title: Great compass!!
customer_reviews.text: Great clip on compass!! Best little compass on the market! :) the degree markings on the bezel are etched, too, so they can’t peel off.
customer_reviews.author: Sensei T

customer_reviews.title: Fell of my dive computer after my second dive
customer_reviews.text: Good compass, but don’t dive with it. It fell off after my second scuba dives. I had it attached to my dive computer band, looked and felt great but I guess it’s not designed to with stand this kind of movement and possible friction with dive gear.
customer_reviews.author: Mohie-eldin Elhalabi

customer_reviews.title: Compass falls out of clip!
customer_reviews.text: This compass is not one piece, it's two: the clip and the compass itself. Like several other reviewers, the compass on mine fell out of the clip and was lost, who knows where. This happened after maybe a week or two attached to my backpack strap. Useless. Worse than useless, really, since you think you have a compass with you and then find out you don't.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Call

customer_reviews.title: Fell out of the plastic holder
customer_reviews.text: The compass was great until it fell out of the socket like some of the other reviewers. I had it on the sternum strap of my pack. I didn't do anything unusual or particularly rough, but when I looked down the compass had fallen out while the plastic part was still there. That's really disappointing because I loved the compass while it lasted.
customer_reviews.author: William Beeves

customer_reviews.title: Accurate but fragile.
customer_reviews.text: This compass was really accurate for a button compass. But when I wore it on my watch band it popped apart the face came off then the compass which is not fastened in fell out. This happened twice the first time I recovered the pieces and put it back together the second time I lost the compass.
customer_reviews.author: Peter M.

customer_reviews.title: Product has design flaws.
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased these clip on compasses twice. First time, both compasses developed bubbles in the fluid causing them not to rotate properly and one finally fell out of the dish it's mounted in. I decided to give them a second chance cause any man made product can fail. But within a week, both new compasses developed the bubbles in the fluid causing the dials not to rotate properly. I'll never purchase this product again and wouldn't really recommend this product to anyone who needs a dependable compass.
customer_reviews.author: Ret Nav

customer_reviews.title: Compass is ok, clipped it on my G Shock ...
customer_reviews.text: Compass is ok, clipped it on my G Shock Mud Master. This compass does not fit well on thick watch straps. Also there are sharp plastic edges in the back had to buy sand paper and sand it down so it would not cut me as a precaution.
customer_reviews.author: BonkersTheCat

customer_reviews.title: Great little compass
customer_reviews.text: This lives on a strap outside of a small backpack. Just nice to have a small but quality made compass at all times
customer_reviews.author: SL

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk! DON'T BUY!
customer_reviews.text: This compass in a piece of junk. The price is a ridiculous outrage. Not accurate at all. I put a SS water bottle down by it and all the sudden the compass needles spun crazy as if world flipped around. It's a bad joke. DONT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jones

customer_reviews.title: This Compass is a "Keeper"
customer_reviews.text: My first Suunto Clipper compass lasted 10 years. Since I purchased it for $10 and it always worked flawlessly, that's a bargain. I slide the compass on my watch band (yes, I use a watch even though I have a smart phone). Sometimes my smart phone compass goes wacky, but my Suunto always works. This compass only cost $15. It seems like the same quality from Suunto. I'd say buy it and wear it always.
customer_reviews.author: Sine Nomine

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work when attached to iWatch strap
customer_reviews.text: I had hoped that this would help with kayaking in mangroves where it’s easy to lose your sense of direction. Unfortunately it appears that the iWatch interferes with the compass. Works fine on a table when compared to compass on iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: MacCody

customer_reviews.title: Compass, Yes. Bezel, No.
customer_reviews.text: The magnetic needle of the compass works for the most part, but the rotating bezel misses the indentations so it spins freely, making keeping a bearing somewhat impossible.
customer_reviews.author: CD

customer_reviews.title: Completely useless
customer_reviews.text: Useless compass. Once attached to my watch strap on wrist, the compass stops working completely. When not attached to anything, or not on my wrist or points roughly north but nothing once on my wrist. ***update*** Used item during a 16 mile hike in a different capacity than I intended. Kept me heading in the direction I needed and although it didnt work attached to my watch strap (may have been because of a magnet inside of my smartwatch) it worked with different placement. Not perfect, but not useless.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value. Durable and reliable
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent little compass for your watch band. I now own 2, for different watches. Solidly accurate. Quite rugged. One of mine is almost 2 years old and still works well. The other is about a year old. For a small watchband compass, I don't think you can get better than these
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: This fits best on 20mm watch bands. 22mm can be squeezed into the clip. My one complaint is that the clip portion, that goes between the band and the skin, has sharp points that can dig into the flesh.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Hallam

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Points North which is good. Quality is not what I expected at this price. It's definitely made of light, cheap feeling plastic. If the price was $10 or less i'd be happier with it. We'll see how it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: The only watch band compass that I know of that works well
customer_reviews.text: It works well and is handy to have. The only downside is that it can be uncomfortable on your wrist. Of course, it is no substitute for a full-size compass. I bought it for snorkeling, and it works great for that, but it is nice to have for hiking or even orienting yourself in a large building or parking lot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazn Customer 1028

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit on a 22mm nato. Super lume for dark use.
customer_reviews.text: This is accurate and reliable, very slim profile, has AWESOME lume (glow), and the rotating bezel and well-placed indicator arrow make it the all-around greatest. I did take a little Emory file to the very tips of the underside of the clip, but even that was almost nitpicking it into perfect. Buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Thomson

customer_reviews.title: This item is a great idea and works well....but quality is not a plus for this item.
customer_reviews.text: MANY of numbers came off the unit.....it was almost two days and is still not good...
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth K.

customer_reviews.title: If you want it, you'll love it
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderfully consistent, if not perfectly precise, compass. I keep it handy for general reference while a full size counterpart sits in my bag. It is durable and beautifully smooth. I have had the bezel pop off and lose the compass itself on one occasion, but I have enjoyed it enough to buy several for myself and for gifts. Once you know what compasses are for and how to use them, you will see the value of a low profile little barnacle like this.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Great, if you want to find your way around the yard. Don't try it for realistic use cases
customer_reviews.text: This compass is good if you are a kid playing in the yard to find essay bearings. If you use this outdoors you could be putting your safety at risk and be worst off. Not the type of product you would expect from Suunto.
customer_reviews.author: Andres

customer_reviews.title: My second one
customer_reviews.text: This compass was so good I bought another after losing mine ( my fault entirely ) - nice small size, accurate ( verified by my Suunto baseplate compass ), good bezel ring and secure clip Perfect second compass to have for double direction verification
customer_reviews.author: ruski3:16

customer_reviews.title: Suunto compass...
customer_reviews.text: Hello we camp alot during the summer and upon researching I found out that this brand suunto is a very good brand so i decided to give it a shot , will be putting it to its paces on our next camping trip!! Thank you..😎
customer_reviews.author: Alfred Yu

customer_reviews.title: Great Compass!
customer_reviews.text: After owning and researching watch and compass combinations, I settled on this clip-on compass for my L. L. Bean field watch. Every combo has either a great watch with a so-so compass or vice versa. This exceptional clip-on compass fits my slim NATO style watch band perfectly. It is small enough to be unobtrusive but big enough to be worthwhile. Now I have the right combination for less money than I would pay for something that looks impressive but doesn't perform both roles well.
customer_reviews.author: Guy B.

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly tough
customer_reviews.text: I just like to have a little backup just in case my phone app fails and this compass slides on a strap and you barely notice it. Its very accurate and worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Russ Cherry

customer_reviews.title: Does not work for me.
customer_reviews.text: I have this in my car and it doesn't work for me. I missed the return date (if there was one) and I really should throw it away.
customer_reviews.author: Mdavisnowell

customer_reviews.title: Nice little compass, worth the money
customer_reviews.text: It fits on my Casio G-Shock band for my Military-Sand GA100SD-8A. I had to fill down the end of the clip it was a little sharp. I have a big wrist and it was digging into it. I little sanding fixed it and I don't even fell it anymore. It has become part of the watch band.
customer_reviews.author: Shop til I drop

customer_reviews.title: Best mini compass I have found
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well made button compass. I would be fine with this if I lost my main compass miles from the nearest road.
customer_reviews.author: skeetshtr

customer_reviews.title: Good backup compass
customer_reviews.text: Good little back up compass. I've owned two, because the first one popped out of its holder on the last hike.... :(
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Very good button type compass for the money!
customer_reviews.text: This compass is a great little compass that is small, lightweight and clips to almost anything. Decent movement which makes finding direction a breeze! If you're looking for a small button type compass then this is it!
customer_reviews.author: JoAmazonDude

customer_reviews.title: Liquid filled compasses will all develop air bubbles!
customer_reviews.text: Like so many liquid filled compasses air bubbles readily form and can block a rapid and accurate reading. In my 24 years as an Army vet, everyone of the liquid filled compasses become filled with bubbles. The old U.S. Army compasses are still the best for the price!!
customer_reviews.author: ann m smith

customer_reviews.title: Nice little liquid filled compass that seems accurate. Handy.
customer_reviews.text: Clips on my watchband and helps me determine north. Liquid filled and seems to work fine. The clip could be a little larger or stronger.
customer_reviews.author: M Peterson

customer_reviews.title: GO CAT GO!
customer_reviews.text: First off, delivery was soooo fat, like nanoseconds later I had it.. I was looking for an implement to keep me on course as I diligently tunnel towards Satan and his chamber of punishment, I have been pleased so far as it gives me some sort of direction in programming my directional boring unit. It was easy to assemble, as you just slip on your watch, obtain your bearing, and go cat go!!
customer_reviews.author: JT Splitrivet

customer_reviews.title: great compass
customer_reviews.text: have been using these since they first came out and they have always been a great tool for my watches, when on sale you can't beat the price so get one if ya are on the fence
customer_reviews.author: SeaHunt

customer_reviews.title: Sub standard wrist compass.
customer_reviews.text: What a complete waste of money. The clip didn’t work with the watch I own. I didn’t have it a whole day. It fell out of the housing it came in and never saw it again. I should have purchased one with its own wrist band.
customer_reviews.author: Freddy

customer_reviews.title: Good compass, hard to read in the dark.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good quality compass of sturdy construction. The glow-in the dark lettering is dim and hard to see unless your eyes are adjusted to the dark.
customer_reviews.author: W. Penn

customer_reviews.title: Very Accurate!
customer_reviews.text: The compass is very accurate. Works great on your backpack (front strap). The compass did pop out of the holder. Probably need some super glue for correction.
customer_reviews.author: david a yarborough

customer_reviews.title: Points North correctly and works as described.
customer_reviews.text: If you are going to Ranger School, and someone told you to get a little clip on your watch compass for quick reference, this one will work. Obviously, it isn't going to be great by itself for land nav. It serves it's purpose.
customer_reviews.author: I. Koch

customer_reviews.title: I have been a diver for over 40 years. ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been a diver for over 40 years. I have had a Compass on my watch since I can remember. I have had a few other brands.... I find Sunnto Cliper to be the most reliable and accurate compass of the them all. I would not look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Goldstein

customer_reviews.title: The compass works
customer_reviews.text: The compass works. But, I'm not sure how long the clip will last. It doesn't clip well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bright, Simple & Low Profile Compass
customer_reviews.text: Fits great on inside wrist of G-Shock wristwatch. Glow in the dark is strong after just a bit of sunshine. Low-profile. Highly recommend for an effective, minimalist compass.
customer_reviews.author: PrinceOfWills

customer_reviews.title: Great clip on compass
customer_reviews.text: Great Compass, features I like: - it has a bearing to allow smooth and quick action that reduces swinging (so you don't have to wait for the compass to settle) - it clips onto you watch band, you shirt pocket, the edge of the map, etc - easy to read - luminous indicators (points) - has an edge pointer that lines up perfectly for me I love as well made tool at a good price
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Suunto Clipper L/B NH compass
product_meta.description: Suunto attachable compasses form a natural part of outdoorgear, freeing up hands and easing the mind.
feature_bullets: Cardinal directions in luminous prints on card
Direction on rotating bezel in 10 degrees increments
A fun, supercompact aid for underwater navigation. Clips to watch strap, sleeve, strap of backpack, side of map etc

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
